com.artemis

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.artemis.World

  • public class World
extends Object
    The primary instance for the framework.

    It contains all the systems. You must use this to create, delete and retrieve entities. It is also important to set the delta each game loop iteration, and initialize before game loop.

    Author:
    Arni Arent, junkdog

    • Field Detail

      • delta

        public float delta
        The time passed since the last update.

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World()
        Creates a world without custom systems.

        EntityManager, ComponentManager and AspectSubscriptionManager are available by default.

        Why are you using this? Use World(WorldConfiguration) to create a world with your own systems.

      • World

        public World(WorldConfiguration configuration)
        Creates a new world.

        EntityManager, ComponentManager and AspectSubscriptionManager are available by default, on top of your own systems.

        See Also:
        WorldConfigurationBuilder, WorldConfiguration

    • Method Detail

      • inject

        public void inject(Object target)
        Inject dependencies on object.

        Immediately perform dependency injection on the target, even if the target isn't of an Artemis class.

        If you want to specify nonstandard dependencies to inject, use WorldConfiguration.register(String, Object) instead, or configure an Injector

        If you want a non-throwing alternative, use inject(Object, boolean)

        Parameters:
        target - Object to inject into. throws MundaneWireException if target is annotated with SkipWire
        See Also:
        for more details about dependency injection., inject(Object, boolean)

      • inject

        public void inject(Object target,
                   boolean failIfNotInjectable)
        Inject dependencies on object.

        Will not if it is annotated with Wire.

        If you want to specify nonstandard dependencies to inject, use WorldConfiguration.register(String, Object) instead, or configure an Injector.

        Parameters:
        target - Object to inject into.
        failIfNotInjectable - if true, this method will throws MundaneWireException if target is annotated with SkipWire and failIfNotInjectable is true
        See Also:
        for more details about dependency injection., inject(Object)

        public <T> T getRegistered(Class<T> type)

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes all systems. Only necessary if either need to free managed resources upon bringing the world to an end.
        Throws:
        ArtemisMultiException - if any system throws an exception.

      • edit

        public EntityEdit edit(int entityId)
        Get entity editor for entity.
        Parameters:
        entityId - entity to fetch editor for.
        Returns:
        a fast albeit verbose editor to perform batch changes to entities.

      • compositionId

        public int compositionId(int entityId)
        Gets the composition id uniquely identifying the component composition of an entity. Each composition identity maps to one unique BitVector.
        Parameters:
        entityId - Entity for which to get the composition id
        Returns:
        composition identity of entity

      • delete

        public void delete(int entityId)
        Delete the entity from the world. The entity is considered to be in a final state once invoked; adding or removing components from an entity scheduled for deletion will likely throw exceptions.
        Parameters:
        entityId - the entity to delete

      • createEntity

        public Entity createEntity()
        Create and return a new or reused entity instance. Entity is automatically added to the world.
        Returns:
        entity
        See Also:
        recommended alternative.

      • create

        public int create()
        Create and return a new or reused entity id. Entity is automatically added to the world.
        Returns:
        assigned entity id, where id >= 0.

      • createEntity

        public Entity createEntity(Archetype archetype)
        Create and return an Entity wrapping a new or reused entity instance. Entity is automatically added to the world. Use Entity.edit() to set up your newly created entity. You can also create entities using:
        • EntityBuilder Convenient entity creation. Not useful when pooling.
        • Archetype Fastest, low level, no parameterized components.
        • Serialization, with a simple prefab-like class to parameterize the entities.
        Returns:
        entity
        See Also:
        recommended alternative.

      • create

        public int create(Archetype archetype)
        Create and return an Entity wrapping a new or reused entity instance. Entity is automatically added to the world. Use Entity.edit() to set up your newly created entity. You can also create entities using: - EntityBuilder Convenient entity creation. Not useful when pooling. - Archetype Fastest, low level, no parameterized components.
        Returns:
        assigned entity id

      • getEntity

        public Entity getEntity(int entityId)
        Get entity with the specified id. Resolves entity id to the unique entity instance. This method may return an entity even if it isn't active in the world. Make sure to not retain id's of deleted entities.
        Parameters:
        entityId - the entities id
        Returns:
        the specific entity

      • getSystems

        public ImmutableBag<BaseSystem> getSystems()
        Gives you all the systems in this world for possible iteration.
        Returns:
        all entity systems in world

        Type Parameters:
        T - the class type of system
        Parameters:
        type - type of system
        Returns:
        instance of the system in this world

      • process

        public void process()
        Process all non-passive systems.
        See Also:
        to control and extend how systems are invoked.

      • getMapper

        public <T extends Component> ComponentMapper<T> getMapper(Class<T> type)
        Retrieves a ComponentMapper instance for fast retrieval of components from entities. Odb automatically injects component mappers into systems, calling this method is usually not required.,
        Type Parameters:
        T - class type of the component
        Parameters:
        type - type of component to get mapper for
        Returns:
        mapper for specified component type

        Returns:
